questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS DATA MANAGEMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS DATA MANAGEMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: What does the law of demand state?
question_texts: What does the law of demand state?

options.option_text: As the price of a good increases, the quantity demanded decreases
As the price of a good decreases, the quantity demanded decreases
As the price of a good increases, the quantity supplied decreases
As the price of a good decreases, the quantity supplied increases

questions.question_text_1: Which function would you use to count the number of cells that meet a specific condition?
question_texts: Which function would you use to count the number of cells that meet a specific condition?

questions.question_text_1: In a saturated smartphone market where 70% of current users express interest in upgrading their phones in the next two months, and the no. of new smartphone users remain unchanged, what should companies/manufacturers prioritize?
question_texts: In a saturated smartphone market where 70% of current users express interest in upgrading their phones in the next two months, and the no. of new smartphone users remain unchanged, what should companies/manufacturers prioritize?

options.option_text: Expand distribution channels to reach untapped geographic regions.
Focus on females as their target customers.
Invest in research and development to create innovative features for newcustomers.
Develop targeted upgrade incentives and promotions for current userslooking to replace their old devices

questions.question_text_1: What does the Days of Sales of Inventory indicate?
question_texts: What does the Days of Sales of Inventory indicate?

options.option_text: The average number of days required by a company to turn its inventory intosales.
The number of days when inventory is zero in a year
Total number of days when inventory sales is zero due to lack of inventory
The average number of inventory stockout days in a month

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following factors is most critical in determining the market potential for a new product ?
question_texts: Which of the following factors is most critical in determining the market potential for a new product ?

options.option_text: The size of the target market and percentage of potential customersinterested in the product.
Historical sale data of unrelated products.
Current market share of existing products.

questions.question_text_1: Which metric is most important to monitor during an A/B test?
question_texts: Which metric is most important to monitor during an A/B test?

options.option_text: Total number of users tested in the experiment
Key performance indicators (KPIs) specific to the experiment

questions.question_text_1:
Arrange the following steps while working with unstructured data in a ranking modelling: 
I. Normalizing II. Preprocessing III. Ranking IV. Composite score
question_texts:
Arrange the following steps while working with unstructured data in a ranking modelling: 
I. Normalizing II. Preprocessing III. Ranking IV. Composite score

questions.question_text_1: If a FinTech company wants to cut down losses, which of the following should they do?
question_texts: If a FinTech company wants to cut down losses, which of the following should they do?

options.option_text: Decrease approval cutoff of credit score
Increase approval cutoff of credit score

questions.question_text_1: PayBuddy conducted an A/B test to understand if their new Funding Instrument recommendation strategy works well. Following are the details of the control and treatment groups. From the given table, which of the following statements are true?  i. Value of Credit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy ii. Value of Debit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy iii. Value of both Credit and Debit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy iv. Value of Credit transactions decreased with the new recommendation strategy v. Value of Debit transactions decreased with the new recommendation strategy

questions.question_text_1:
PePhone is a FinTech firm that processes payments. Following are sources of revenue for the company – 3.5% of transaction amount as transaction fee from merchant for all types of transactions (credit and debit), 18% p.a. interest on credit transactions and incurs a loss of credit if not paid back. Calculate the overall profit for the company based on the below table – (Assume payback of credit in a year) 
Note: Declined transactions will not get credit but customers will complete the payment through PePhone using their bank details.
questions.question_text_2:

Following are sources of revenue for the company – 3.5% of transaction amount as transaction fee from merchant for all types of transactions (credit and debit), 18% p.a. interest on credit transactions and incurs a loss of credit if not paid back. Calculate the overall profit for the company based on the below table – (Assume payback of credit in a year) 
Note: Declined transactions will not get credit but customers will complete the payment through PePhone using their bank details.

Calculate the overall profit for the company based on the below table – (Assume payback of credit in a year) 
Note: Declined transactions will not get credit but customers will complete the payment through PePhone using their bank details.

Following are sources of revenue for the company – 3.5% of transaction amount as transaction fee from merchant for all types of transactions (credit and debit), 18% p.a. interest on credit transactions and incurs a loss of credit if not paid back. questions.question_text_1: Which of the following conditions can use the concept of "weighted average" to analyse expenditure data?
question_texts: Which of the following conditions can use the concept of "weighted average" to analyse expenditure data?

options.option_text: By considering importance of expenditure categories
By considering the population size of different regions
By adjusting for inflation over time
By analyzing the impact of income levels on expenditure

questions.question_text_1: In Excel, the SUBTOTAL function is used to perform calculations on a filtered range of data. Which of the following statements about the SUBTOTAL function is correct?
question_texts: In Excel, the SUBTOTAL function is used to perform calculations on a filtered range of data. Which of the following statements about the SUBTOTAL function is correct?

options.option_text: SUBTOTAL can only calculate the sum of a range and ignores hidden rows inthe filtered data.
SUBTOTAL can perform various calculations, including sum, average, count,and more, and it ignores rows hidden by filters.
SUBTOTAL performs calculations only on rows that are manually hidden, notthose hidden by filters.
SUBTOTAL can calculate results based on data in any worksheet, regardless ofwhether the data is visible or hidden.

props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** for the **Business Data Management (Computer-Based Exam)** based on the question paper, followed by **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships.

---

---

### **Core Topics & Concepts Summary**
#### **1. Business Economics & Demand Analysis**
- **Law of Demand**:
  - **Concept**: Inverse relationship between price and quantity demanded (all else equal).
  - **Equation**:
    \[
    Q_d = f(P^{-1}, \text{Income}, \text{Preferences}, \text{etc.})
    \]
  - **Key Point**: Higher price → Lower quantity demanded (Option A in Q2).

- **Income Elasticity of Demand**:
  - **Normal Goods**: Demand ↑ when income ↑ (e.g., Q15: 60 → 90 units as income rises from ₹15k to ₹25k).
  - **Inferior Goods**: Demand ↓ when income ↑ (not the case here).
  - **Luxury Goods**: High income elasticity (not directly tested here).

- **Total Revenue (TR)**:
  - **Equation**:
    \[
    TR = P \times Q
    \]
  - **Example (Q14)**:
    - Income Level 1: \( TR_1 = 40 \times 60 = ₹2400 \)
    - Income Level 2: \( TR_2 = 38 \times 90 = ₹3420 \)
    - **Percentage Change**:
      \[
      \frac{TR_2 - TR_1}{TR_1} \times 100 = \frac{3420 - 2400}{2400} \times 100 = 42.5\%
      \]

---

#### **2. Inventory Management**
- **Days Sales of Inventory (DSI)**:
  - **Concept**: Average days to sell inventory (Q5).
  - **Equation**:
    \[
    DSI = \frac{\text{Average Inventory}}{\text{Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)}} \times 365
    \]
  - **Interpretation**: Lower DSI → Faster inventory turnover.

---

#### **3. Market Analysis & Strategy**
- **Market Potential**:
  - **Key Factors** (Q6):
    - Size of target market.
    - % of potential customers interested.
  - **Saturated Market Strategy** (Q4):
    - Prioritize **upgrade incentives** for existing users (not new customer acquisition).

- **A/B Testing**:
  - **Critical Metric** (Q7): **KPIs specific to the experiment** (e.g., conversion rate, transaction value).
  - **Example (Q10)**:
    - Compare **treatment vs. control** groups for credit/debit transaction values.
    - **Conclusion**: Credit transactions ↓ (1810 → 1725), Debit transactions ↑ (2679 → 2780) → **Option D (ii & iv)**.

---

#### **4. Financial Analysis for FinTech**
- **Profit Calculation** (Q11):
  - **Revenue Streams**:
    1. **Transaction Fee**: 3.5% of transaction amount.
    2. **Interest on Credit**: 18% p.a. (if paid back).
    3. **Loss on Default**: Full credit amount lost.
  - **Example Calculation**:
    - **Approved & Paid Back (Cust ID 17289)**:
      - Fee: \( 168 \times 0.035 = 5.88 \)
      - Interest: \( 168 \times 0.18 = 30.24 \)
      - **Total**: \( 5.88 + 30.24 = 36.12 \)
    - **Approved & Defaulted (Cust ID 17290)**:
      - Fee: \( 109 \times 0.035 = 3.815 \)
      - Loss: \( -109 \)
      - **Total**: \( 3.815 - 109 = -105.185 \)
    - **Declined (Cust ID 17291)**: Only transaction fee (no credit).
    - **Net Profit**: Sum all cases → **-₹192.72** (Option B).

- **Credit Risk Mitigation** (Q9):
  - **Action**: Increase **approval cutoff of credit score** to reduce defaults.

---

#### **5. Data Processing & Excel Functions**
- **COUNTIF**:
  - **Purpose**: Count cells meeting a condition (Q3).
  - **Syntax**: `=COUNTIF(range, criteria)`

- **SUBTOTAL**:
  - **Purpose**: Perform calculations (sum, average, etc.) on **filtered data**, ignoring hidden rows (Q13).
  - **Syntax**: `=SUBTOTAL(function_num, range)`
    - `function_num`: 1 (average), 9 (sum), etc.

- **Weighted Average**:
  - **Applications** (Q12):
    - Importance of expenditure categories.
    - Population size of regions.
  - **Equation**:
    \[
    \text{Weighted Avg} = \sum (w_i \times x_i)
    \]
    where \( w_i \) = weight, \( x_i \) = value.

---

#### **6. Sales & Revenue Analysis**
- **Total Revenue Calculation** (Q16):
  - **Equation**:
    \[
    TR = \sum (\text{Monthly Sales} \times \text{Unit Price})
    \]
  - **Example**:
    - **Widget A**: \( (120 + 150 + 130) \times 25 = 10,000 \)
    - **Total for All Products**: ₹67,125 (Option A).

- **Sales Trends** (Q17):
  - **Continuously Increasing**: Check month-over-month growth (e.g., **Widget C**: 100 → 110 → 120).

- **Revenue Contribution** (Q18):
  - **Widget Revenue**: Sum of all widget sales (SKU01, SKU02, SKU06).
  - **Percentage**:
    \[
    \frac{\text{Widget Revenue}}{\text{Total Revenue}} \times 100 = 30.1\%
    \]

---

#### **7. Operational Efficiency (OEE)**
- **Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE)**:
  - **Components** (Q19–Q22):
    1. **Availability**:
       \[
       \text{Availability (\%)} = \frac{\text{Planned Prod. Time} - \text{Lost Time}}{\text{Planned Prod. Time}} \times 100
       \]
       - Given: 87.5% → Solve for **Lost Time (X1 = 1 hr)**.
    2. **Performance**:
       \[
       \text{Performance (\%)} = \frac{\text{Actual Output}}{\text{Design Speed} \times \text{Runtime}} \times 100
       \]
       - Given: 90% → Solve for **Actual Speed (X2 = 180 units/hr)**.
    3. **Quality**:
       \[
       \text{Quality (\%)} = \frac{\text{Good Units}}{\text{Total Units Produced}} \times 100
       \]
       - **Good Units = 1050**, Total Units = \( 180 \times (8 - 1) = 1260 \) → **X3 ≈ 83.3%**.
    4. **OEE**:
       \[
       OEE = \text{Availability} \times \text{Performance} \times \text{Quality} \approx 65.5\%
       \]

---

#### **8. HR & Recruitment Terminology** (Q23–Q25)
| **Term**            | **Description**                                                                 |
|----------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Indent**           | HR form outlining budget, skills, etc. (Q23).                                  |
| **Employee Referral**| Sourcing candidates via existing employees’ networks (Q24).                     |
| **Appraisal**        | Evaluating employee performance (Q25).                                         |

---

### **Mermaid Knowledge Graphs**
#### **Graph 1: Business Economics & Market Analysis**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Law of Demand] -->|Inverse Relationship| B[Price ↑ → Quantity Demanded ↓]
    A --> C[Income Elasticity]
    C --> D[Normal Goods: Demand ↑ with Income ↑]
    C --> E[Inferior Goods: Demand ↓ with Income ↑]
    B --> F[Total Revenue = Price × Quantity]
    F --> G[Percentage Change in TR]
    A --> H[Market Potential]
    H --> I[Target Market Size]
    H --> J[Customer Interest %]
```

#### **Graph 2: Financial Analysis & A/B Testing**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[FinTech Profit] --> B[Revenue Streams]
    B --> C[Transaction Fees: 3.5%]
    B --> D[Interest on Credit: 18% p.a.]
    B --> E[Loss on Default]
    A --> F[A/B Testing]
    F --> G[Key Metric: KPIs]
    G --> H[Compare Treatment vs. Control]
    H --> I[Credit Transactions ↓]
    H --> J[Debit Transactions ↑]
```

#### **Graph 3: Data Processing & Excel**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Excel Functions] --> B[COUNTIF]
    B --> C[Count Cells Meeting Condition]
    A --> D[SUBTOTAL]
    D --> E[Calculate on Filtered Data]
    E --> F[Ignore Hidden Rows]
    A --> G[Weighted Average]
    G --> H[Expenditure Analysis]
    G --> I[Population Size Adjustments]
```

#### **Graph 4: Operational Efficiency (OEE)**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[OEE] --> B[Availability]
    B --> C[(Planned Time - Lost Time)/Planned Time]
    A --> D[Performance]
    D --> E[Actual Output/Design Output]
    A --> F[Quality]
    F --> G[Good Units/Total Units]
    A --> H[OEE = Availability × Performance × Quality]
```

#### **Graph 5: Sales & Inventory**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Sales Analysis] --> B[Total Revenue]
    B --> C[Sum of Monthly Sales × Unit Price]
    A --> D[Sales Trends]
    D --> E[Month-over-Month Growth]
    A --> F[Inventory Management]
    F --> G[Days Sales of Inventory]
    G --> H[Inventory Turnover Speed]
```
